intro: Viola betonicifolia var. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered violet, is a variant of the viola genus characterized by its pale or white petals. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
